levelContents.level11: Basic theoretical knowledge of networking (knowing the main networking components and protocols)

levelContents.level21: Understand how SAP Systems communicate over the network
levelContents.level23: Theoretical understanding of SAP secure communications
levelContents.level24: Capability to cooperate with network experts in solving networking issues

levelContents.level31: Knows the network concepts that facilitate communication between SAP systems and other applications (interfacing with other non-SAP applications)
levelContents.level32: Basic knowledge of SAP network security (gateway security, certificate, SNC….)
levelContents.level33: Awareness regarding the dependencies between different SAP communication channels (how will a component failure affect the entire SAP ecosystem)

levelContents.level41: Provides specialized technical guidance on complex architecture challenges
levelContents.level42: Able to analyze existing network structure in order to define, design and achieve simplified, application- focused network architectures (finding bottlenecks, network tuning etc.)

levelContents.level12: File structure knowledge (content, permissions, navigation commands)
levelContents.level13: Being able to execute basic operating commands (familiar with terminal command lines)

levelContents.level24: Basic OS performance management (identifying situations where resources are over-used – memory/CPU/disk)
levelContents.level25: Ability to install / activate additional OS components (Windows additional features, Unix packages)
levelContents.level26: User and Groups Management  (handling user policies in relation with network domains etc.)

levelContents.level34: Advanced OS System Structure knowledge:Peripheral Management;Memory Management;Filesystem Management;Application Management
levelContents.level35: Patching OS according to SAP requirements

levelContents.level42: Understanding how SAP components make use of low-level OS functionality (why are certain libraries, function calls etc. being called by SAP components)
levelContents.level43: Design and implement high availability OS environments

levelContents.level13: Identify DB processes and file structure at OS level
levelContents.level15: Able to locate and interpret  DB logs
